results.title: Diabetes and uterine fibroid diagnosis in midlife: Study of Women's Health Across the Nation (SWAN).
results.text_hl: Time-varying @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@, @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@, HOMA-IR, and @GENE_SHBG @GENE_6462 @@@SHBG@@@ were not associated with @<m>DISEASE_Leiomyoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007889 @@@fibroid@@@ diagnosis. However, @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ was associated with a 28% lower incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Leiomyoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007889 @@@fibroid@@@ diagnosis (adjusted HR: 0.72, 95% CI: 0.44, 1.17), driven by participants using @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (adjusted HR: 0.49, 95% CI: 0.21, 1.12), though precision was limited.

citations.NLM: Mitro SD, Waetjen LE, Lee C, Wise LA, Zaritsky E, Harlow SD, El Khoudary SR, Santoro N, Solomon DH, Thurston RC, Hedderson MM. Diabetes and uterine fibroid diagnosis in midlife: Study of Women's Health Across the Nation (SWAN). J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2024 Sep 11;():. PMID: 39257183
citations.BibTeX: @article{39257183, title={Diabetes and uterine fibroid diagnosis in midlife: Study of Women's Health Across the Nation (SWAN).}, author={Mitro SD and Waetjen LE and Lee C and Wise LA and Zaritsky E and Harlow SD and El Khoudary SR and Santoro N and Solomon DH and Thurston RC and Hedderson MM}, journal={J Clin Endocrinol Metab}}

results.title: The antidiabetic drug metformin inhibits uterine leiomyoma cell proliferation via an AMP-activated protein kinase signaling pathway.
results.text_hl: These experimental findings show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is a potent inhibitor of cell proliferation in @<m>DISEASE_Leiomyoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007889 @@@leiomyoma@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Li B, Takeda T, Tsuiji K, Kondo A, Kitamura M, Wong TF, Yaegashi N. The antidiabetic drug metformin inhibits uterine leiomyoma cell proliferation via an AMP-activated protein kinase signaling pathway. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2013 Jan;29(1):87-90. PMID: 22835064
citations.BibTeX: @article{22835064, title={The antidiabetic drug metformin inhibits uterine leiomyoma cell proliferation via an AMP-activated protein kinase signaling pathway.}, author={Li B and Takeda T and Tsuiji K and Kondo A and Kitamura M and Wong TF and Yaegashi N}, journal={Gynecol Endocrinol}, volume={29}, number={1}, pages={87-90}}
